intro: Chaetospora effusa, commonly known as the hairy lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Lecanoraceae. It is characterized by its foliose thallus, which is typically bright green or yellowish in color. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a photosynthetic partner, usually a green alga, and a fungal partner from the Ascomycota division. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on bark or soil surfaces. Its structure includes a complex arrangement of hyphae and algal cells, contributing to its ecological role in nutrient cycling and soil stabilization.
